popt4jlib
Class LimitedTimeEvalFunction

java.lang.Object
  popt4jlib.LimitedTimeEvalFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
FunctionIntf, java.io.Serializable
public class LimitedTimeEvalFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf

The class is a wrapper class for FunctionIntf objects, that forces the function to execute in a different thread than the calling thread, allowing only up to a certain amount of time for execution.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
LimitedTimeEvalFunction(FunctionIntf f, long millis2wait)
          public constructor, setting up a LimitedTimeTaskExecutor object that allows running tasks for up to millis2wait milliseconds in different threads in the executor's thread-pool.

Method Detail

eval

public double eval(java.lang.Object arg,
                   java.util.HashMap params)
the function evaluation method of the class: creates a new FunctionEvaluationTask object and submits it to the LimitedTimeTaskExecutor object associated with this object for execution. This method is guaranteed to return in no more than millis2wait milliseconds (the second argument passed in the object's constructor). If the evaluation of the underlying function takes more time than the maximum allowed time, then this method will return Double.MAX_VALUE

Specified by:
eval in interface FunctionIntf
Parameters:
arg - Object the argument of the function to be evaluated.
params - HashMap the parameters of the function to be evaluated.
Returns:
double the function value or Double.MAX_VALUE if the evaluation takes too long.

getEvalCount

public long getEvalCount()
return the total number of calls made to eval(arg,params)

Returns:
long

getSucEvalCount

public long getSucEvalCount()
return the total number of successful (on-time) evaluations

Returns:
long
